intro: Cynoglossum scabrum, commonly known as rough hound's tongue, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, rough leaves and distinctive blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in meadows and along woodland edges. It has a short flowering period in late summer and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies. The seeds are small and often dispersed by wind, aiding in its spread across different habitats.
